Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs.

charity.name: Macmillan Cancer Support
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

I have set this page up on behalf of Susan's husband Allan. Susan sadly lost her battle with cancer on 18th December after a long hard fight. 

Susan was loved by everybody who knew her. Her infectious smile would light up any room and with a heart as big as the world she would do anything for absolutely anybody. 

Any donations will be hugely appreciated 

Thanks all of the Barnard family. 😘😇

charity.name: Macmillan Cancer Support
eventName: Mads Forty Days of Fitness n Veggies
story:
Thanks for checking out my fundraising page, gang! 

Anyone who knows me knows that my existence outside of work involves being wrapped up like a fajita on the settee, watching telly and eating - usually something chocolatey, cheese-laden and/or fried. As much as this is a smug, nice, comfy, easy existence for me, it’s a wasted body not being put to good use.

So! Time for a change. Time to throw out normality and comfort. The challenge is simple:

* Do some sort of exercise, every day, for FORTY DAYS

* Eat plant-based grub, every day, for FORTY DAYS 

* Track my progress, every day, for FORTY DAYS for you, dear avid sponsor

This will be a tough, but it’s nothing compared to the  sacrifice of comfort and normality that those living with cancer have to endure.

I’ll be paying penalties for:

- A missed day of exercise: a £10 out of my own money 

- A meal with meat: £10 

- A meal that’s non-vegan (but vegetarian) - £1 

... And that’s it! 

Macmillan have helped my family on numerous occasions, and actively so at the moment. We are hugely indebted to them for their support. 

If you’d like to support me, and Macmillan, please donate! 

Thanks again for looking!

“Macmillan Cancer Support is here to help everyone with cancer live life as fully as they can, providing physical, financial and emotional support. So whatever cancer throws your way, we’re right right there with you.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs.”
title: Mads's Forty Days of Fitness n Veggies

charity.description: With your support, we aim to fund over £100 million of research each year into all heart and circulatory diseases and the things that cause them. Heart diseases. Stroke. Vascular dementia. Diabetes. They're all connected, and they're all under our microscope. Together we can beat heartbreak forever.
charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
Go The Distance .100 Km . 

My 36-year-old daughter had a massive heart attack on Boxing Day 2019, she had suffered two minor heart attacks in the run up to Christmas which she had thought was sress/anxiety pains! She had three stents fitted but unfortunately her heart is still only pumping at 31%. Naturally she gets tired very easily.  Every daily chore is an effort but  she is always smiling and making light of her situation. She has to as she had a young family aged six and eight. The British Heart Foundation have been amazing with her rehab until lockdown but despite that, they  keep in contact with her on a regular basis by telephone. The support and encouragement she draws from them is what keeps her going. They need as much funding as they can get. 

At Easter time my fiancé was rushed to hospital and was diagnosed with arterial fibrillation. 

These events to my loved ones made me put things into perspective and I realised I needed to change my lifestyle or I could be the next one! When asked what I wanted for my 60th birthday the obvious answer seemed to be a treadmill!  It was my intention to ensure my minimum steps were carried out on a daily basis especially on those more sedate days when I was sat in the office. However after a couple of weeks it got boring and I felt I needed to do something which would be a challenge and I could see an improvement into my exercise regime. NHS couch to 5K was the obvious choice. It is a nine week program at the end of which you should be able to jog/run for 30 minutes. I have currently just finished week six and being able to jog for 25 minutes I am now officially a runner. 🙂👍The next three weeks are the hardest but I aim to keep going until I graduate - 3 consecutive runs at 30 minutes each. When I saw this challenge it was like a light bulb moment inside my head – is this what I have been training for. I don’t think I’ll ever cover 5K but 100 K in 36 days is hopefully doable. I would like to raise a minimum of £250 to go towards this wonderful charity. It would be nice to add an extra “0” to the end of that but knowing the difficult year everybody has had any contribution would be more than appreciated. I would like to thank you for your generosity, I hope you and your families all stay safe and well and that you will never need the services of the British Heart Foundation.

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story:
There are many worthwhile causes out there. Becky and I have chosen this one because we are totally addicted to chocolate and know this will be a huge challenge for us! 

We have made the decision to make ourselves accountable and so giving up something we love (chocolate) is a huge challenge! We can easily give up wine, gin, sweets but chocolate is to us like nicotine is to a smoker! 

All jokes aside,  2020 has been a huge challenge for many of us in lots of different ways and now more than ever it has shown us how precious our lives are and how things can change in a heartbeat. 

Virtual fundraising challenges like Dechox are a way to support research and charities. Because despite everything else happening at the moment, heart and circulatory diseases are still the world's biggest killers. For the sake of our mums and dads, brothers and sisters, grandparents, friends and our own health, please help us exceed our target!
title: Danielle & Beckys Dechox Fundraising Page
pageSummary: We are dechoxing; no chocolate Jan & March 2021! because Life can change in a heartbeat!

charity.name: British Heart Foundation
story: Thanks for visiting my page. I'm raising money for the British Heart Foundation and I'd be so grateful for your support. The BHF has helped halve the number of people dying from heart and circulatory disease in the UK but sadly every day hundreds of people lose their lives. Fortunately, my mother still lives today after her own illness. It's only thanks to support from people like us that the BHF can create new treatments and discover new cures. £24 could pay for two hours of research by an early career scientist, but every pound helps so please give what you can to help me hit my target. Thanks!

charity.name: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
story:
This January, I'm kickstarting 2021 by taking part in Running off Christmas. I'll be running 31 miles throughout the month to raise money for Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity (GOSH Charity). After all the festivities and with the cold and wet weather January can bring, your donations to support Great Ormond Street Hospital's life saving work will keep me going when I need it most.

It's quick, easy and secure to donate, just press the Give Now button!

GOSH's patients, families and staff need your support now more than ever.

charity.name: Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity
story:
This January, I'm kickstarting 2021 by taking part in Running off Christmas. I'll be running a minimum of 31 miles throughout the month to raise money for Great Ormond Street Hospital Children's Charity (GOSH Charity).

As many of you will know GOSH treated my eldest niece when she was born very poorly and also looked after my Brother and his wife whilst they dealt with their newborn being so very unwell. The support they provide is irreplaceable and invaluable.

After all the festivities and with the cold and wet weather January can bring, your donations to support Great Ormond Street Hospital's life saving work will keep me going when I need it most.

It's quick, easy and secure to donate, just press the Give Now button!

GOSH's patients, families and staff need your support now more than ever.

charity.description:
We are the world’s largest charity dedicated to saving lives through research.
Our vision is to bring forward the day when all cancers are cured.

Cancer Research UK is a registered charity in England and Wales (1089464), Scotland (SC041666), the Isle of Man (1103) and Jersey (247).

charity.description:
We are the world’s largest charity dedicated to saving lives through research.
Our vision is to bring forward the day when all cancers are cured.

Cancer Research UK is a registered charity in England and Wales (1089464), Scotland (SC041666), the Isle of Man (1103) and Jersey (247).
charity.name: Cancer Research UK
charity.registrationNumber: in England and Wales 1089464, Scotland SC041666
eventName: Yatton Cancer Research Raffle For a Patchwork Throw
story:
We are 6 friends who have raised money over the last 12 years to support our local Cancer Research branch. 

Each year, we raffle our hand stitched patchwork throw, however this year has made the act of selling raffle tickets a little bit more tricky, so we are turning to just giving instead. 

Each raffle ticket is £1, the more £1 you kindly donate, the more raffle tickets you purchase and the bigger the chance of winning. 

Please add your email address in the ‘make a comment’ section or send an email to inge@sykes.org.uk with your email address and the number of tickets you have purchased. 

A winner will then be selected at random when we have raised £250.

The boring bits: 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.description: Marie Curie provides care and support for people living with any terminal illness across the UK. Our nurses work night and day in people’s homes and our hospices offer specialist care. We also support people emotionally, provide practical information, and match them with trained volunteers.
charity.name: Marie Curie
eventName: Sponsor Daffodil Planting at Sandy Airfield
story:
In an effort to brighten up our airfield a little and support Marie Curie in these times, we will have something new to look forward to in the spring of 2021, Sandy Airfield have purchased over 1000 Daffodil bulbs, together with the kind volunteer effort of our aircraft owners and their spouses, we have spent many days over the last few months planting the Dutch Master variety, chosen for their hardiness to open spaces and winds, with the ambition to see them blossom along the edges of our two runways, a spectacle for pilots coming into land and for visitors at our cafe, should we not be able to open to the public in Covid times, passers by will be able to see them in bloom when travelling out from Moggerhanger on the Bedford Road. Feel free to drop in by air or road to see them in the Spring.

Your donation would be warmly received, all proceeds made through Just Giving will go fully to Marie Curie to support the wonderful work they do for people in times of need.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.name: Marie Curie
story:
Denis left us on Wednesday 23rd December 2020, passing away peacefully at the age of 92. His release comes at the end of a rich and active life, filled with sporting and business achievements, spending time with his family and being the perfect social host alongside his beloved wife Lis, who was always his priority. If you would like to show a token of your respect at this sad time, Denis asked that donations be given to Marie Curie, to support the work they do to assist those at the end of their life.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. charity.description: RNLI volunteer lifeboat crews provide a 24-hour search and rescue service all around the UK and Ireland, while lifeguards keep a careful watch on the UK’s busiest beaches. RNLI lifesaving and drowning prevention depend on supporter fundraising and the generous donations that you and others give.
charity.name: RNLI - Royal National Lifeboat Institution
story:
Too many people are still drowning. More than ever we need the RNLI’s help. As a charity, the RNLI depends on our donations so it can go on saving lives and keeping us and our loved ones safe. 

RNLI lifesavers are our lifeline. They’re the lifeboat crews who provide 24-hour search and rescue right around the UK and Ireland. The lifeguards keeping watch on 240 of the busiest beaches in the UK and Channel Islands. And the RNLI safety teams and educators working tirelessly to stop people getting into trouble in the first place.

Thank you.

charity.description:
We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
story: IF YOU GO DOWN TO THE WOODS TODAY... You might notice theres less wildlife than there used to be. Thats because half of all UK species are in decline were losing our precious red squirrels, hedgehogs and birds at an alarming rate. By taking part in The Big Winter Wander, you and your friends and family can reconnect with our country's beautiful wildlife and help protect it. The funds you raise will help us campaign to protect wildlife here, and around the world. Nature has been there to offer us comfort during difficult times, and now its our time to give back.

Your support is much appreciated.

charity.description: Right now, millions of children are in danger. They face violence, disease, hunger and the chaos of war and disaster. Unicef ensures more children get life-saving food, vaccinations, education and protection than anyone else. With your help, we can build a safer world for children. unicef.org.uk
charity.name: Unicef UK
eventName: Give for the Good of It
story:
Give for the Good of It!

Every Boxing Day, we look forward to splashing some of our hard-earned cash in sales throughout the country.

In these unprecedented times of COVID-19, many of us will turn to the websites of our favourite brands in the hope of securing some bargains.

Imagine if we spent just a small fraction of this on a better cause...

You could change someone's life.

If you can spend £50 on that jacket you've had your eye on, surely you can afford to give £5 to a good cause.

UNICEF operate across 190 countries worldwide to provide services such as

  • nutrition, life-saving food
  • education
  • emergency relief for children
  • protection from climate change
  • water, sanitation and hygiene
  • vaccines

These innocent children deserve so much more than the harsh conditions that have become a part of normality for them.

To find out more about UNICEF's life-changing work, feel free to visit their website: https://www.unicef.org.uk/

Open your hearts and give whatever you can.

(May God accept our efforts)

Peace and Love <3


(all information/ images sourced from https://www.unicef.org.uk/ )

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
story: I am challenging myself to drink nothing but water this January. I am taking on the ultimate detox by avoiding caffeine, alcohol and all other drinks while supporting WaterAid. Give before 4 February 2021 and your donation will be doubled by the UK government, up to £2 million, making double the difference in communities across Ethiopia. Together, we will bring clean water to 50,000 people in Ethiopia and thousands more around the world, helping them change their own lives, forever. If you would like further information about the difference your gift will make and the positive impact it will have on peoples lives, please visit us at www.wateraid.org/uk

charity.description: WaterAid is an international not-for-profit, determined to make clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene normal for everyone, everywhere within a generation. Only by tackling these three essentials in ways that last can people change their lives for good.
charity.name: WaterAid
story:
Clean water, decent toilets and good hygiene should be a normal part of everyone’s daily life. Without all three, people can’t live dignified, healthy lives. With all three, they can unlock their potential, break free from poverty and change their lives for good. 

Give before 4 February 2021 and your donation will be doubled by the UK government, up to £2 million, making double the difference in climate-vulnerable communities.
